perturbation.original_text:
9.3
To remunerate HGF on the basis of thirty percent (30%) of net Company income basis on an annual basis commencing 12 months after the
first full 12-month revenue period.
perturbation.changed_text:
9.3
To remunerate HGF on the basis of thirty percent (30%) of net Company income basis on an annual basis commencing immediately after the Effective Date. HGF will receive an advance payment of $10,000 USD per month, deducted from the annual thirty percent (30%) of net Company income.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that HGF will be remunerated commencing immediately after the Effective Date, while the original text states that remuneration will begin 12 months after the first full 12-month revenue period. There is also an advance payment that affects the payment terms.

perturbation.original_text:
12.1
The distribution will be based on NVOS audited review and will be made within three months of annual considerations on the basis of a
seventy percent (70%) of net profit to NVOS and thirty percent (30%) of net profit to HGF.
perturbation.changed_text:
12.1
The distribution will be based on NVOS unaudited review and will be made within six months of annual considerations on the basis of a
sixty percent (60%) of net profit to NVOS and forty percent (40%) of net profit to HGF. NVOS has the right to delay or withhold distribution payments if cash flow conditions dictate.
perturbation.explanation: This creates an in-text contradiction by altering the distribution percentages (70/30 to 60/40), changing the distribution review from audited to unaudited, extending the payment deadline, and giving NVOS the right to delay payments.

perturbation.original_text:
17.1
All company records will be kept for a minimum of five (5) years unless otherwise required by federal or provincial law.
perturbation.changed_text:
17.1
All company records will be kept for a minimum of two (2) years unless otherwise required by federal or provincial law. NVOS may discard records deemed unnecessary at its sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction by reducing the minimum record-keeping period from five years to two years and giving NVOS sole discretion to discard records, conflicting with the requirement to keep them for the minimum period.
